content.text: HTML Tables
HTML tables allow web developers to arrange data into rows and columns.
content.html: HTML tables allow web developers to arrange data into rows and columns.

content.code_html:
Company Contact Country
Alfreds Futterkiste Maria Anders Germany
Centro comercial Moctezuma Francisco Chang Mexico
Ernst Handel Roland Mendel Austria
Island Trading Helen Bennett UK
Laughing Bacchus Winecellars Yoshi Tannamuri Canada
Magazzini Alimentari Riuniti Giovanni Rovelli Italy

content.text: Define an HTML Table
A table in HTML consists of table cells inside rows and columns.
content.html: A table in HTML consists of table cells inside rows and columns.

content.code_html:
<table>
  <tr>
    <th>Company</th>
    <th>Contact</th>
    <th>Country</th>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Alfreds Futterkiste</td>
    <td>Maria Anders</td>
    <td>Germany</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Centro comercial Moctezuma</td>
    <td>Francisco Chang</td>
    <td>Mexico</td>
  </tr>
</table>

content.text: Table Cells
Each table cell is defined by a and a tag.
content.html: Each table cell is defined by a <td> and a </td> tag.

content.text: td stands for table data.
Everything between and is the content of a table cell.
content.html: Everything between <td> and </td> is the content of a table cell.

content.code_html:
<table>
  <tr>
    <td>Emil</td>
    <td>Tobias</td>
    <td>Linus</td>
  </tr>
</table>

content.text: Note: A table cell can contain all sorts of HTML elements: text, images, lists, links, other tables, etc.
content.html: Note: A table cell can contain all sorts of HTML elements: text, images, lists, links, other tables, etc.

content.text: Table Rows
Each table row starts with a <tr> and ends with a </tr> tag.
content.html: Each table row starts with a <tr> and ends with a </tr> tag.

content.text: tr stands for table row.

content.code_html:
<table>
  <tr>
    <td>Emil</td>
    <td>Tobias</td>
    <td>Linus</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>16</td>
    <td>14</td>
    <td>10</td>
  </tr>
</table>

content.text: You can have as many rows as you like in a table; just make sure that the number of cells are the same in each row.
content.html: You can have as many rows as you like in a table; just make sure that the number of cells are the same in each row.

content.text: Note: There are times when a row can have less or more cells than another. You will learn about that in a later chapter.
content.html: Note: There are times when a row can have less or more cells than another. You will learn about that in a later chapter.

content.text: Table Headers
Sometimes you want your cells to be table header cells. In those cases use the <th> tag instead of the <td> tag:
content.html: Sometimes you want your cells to be table header cells. In those cases use the <th> tag instead of the <td> tag:

content.text: th stands for table header.

content.code_html:
<table>
  <tr>
    <th>Person 1</th>
    <th>Person 2</th>
    <th>Person 3</th>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Emil</td>
    <td>Tobias</td>
    <td>Linus</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>16</td>
    <td>14</td>
    <td>10</td>
  </tr>
</table>

content.text: By default, the text in <th> elements are bold and centered, but you can change that with CSS.
content.html: By default, the text in <th> elements are bold and centered, but you can change that with CSS.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the correct tag name for a table-cell in HTML?
content.html: What is the correct tag name for a table-cell in HTML?

metadata.question: What is the correct tag name for a table-cell in HTML?

content.question: What is the correct tag name for a table-cell in HTML?

content.text: HTML Table Tags

content.code_html:
Tag Description
<table> Defines a table
<th> Defines a header cell in a table
<tr> Defines a row in a table
<td> Defines a cell in a table
<caption> Defines a table caption
<colgroup> Specifies a group of one or more columns in a table for formatting
<col> Specifies column properties for each column within a <colgroup> element
<thead> Groups the header content in a table
<tbody> Groups the body content in a table
<tfoot> Groups the footer content in a table

content.text: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference .
content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
